author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In fields of strife, where man doth vie,
Ukraine embarks, its banners ply,
Torn soldiers Russian, prisoners nigh,
A tale of war, these lands belies.

With heav'n's vault above in sigh,
A worldwide tax entwines with lies,
In labyrinth Congress doth not try,
As tangled fate to man applies.

And as the worldly news unfolds,
A chorus of events untold,
In prose of goat and snail be told,
Through rabbit ears and dog's soft hold.

feedItems.title: Tattered and Bandaged, Russian POWs Describe Ukraine's Offensive
feedItems.description: The first battles in Ukraine’s big offensive, aimed at retaking land in the country’s south and east occupied by Russia, are yielding a steady flow of Russian prisoners.

feedItems.title: Global Tax Mess Awaits U.S. Companies, and Congress Isn't Helping
feedItems.description: The consequences of an international minimum-tax agreement are about to be felt.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In fine quill, I take to script tales anew,
Of coin and commerce, Business & Finance brew,
Their doings 'cross this boundless realm doth span,
And gently blend into the balmy winds that fan

When Fathers' Day arrives with sombre shade,
For Dads estranged, the pain cuts like a blade,
In hearts of love, held hostage by life's strife,
They yearn to mend the bond 'tween child and life

O, glimpse the silver mirror of our days,
And meet the countenance who greets thy gaze,
A future self we oft forsake or bay,
With shortsight, impel our fates to farthest sway

feedItems.title: For Estranged Dads, Father's Day Is a Painful Reminder
feedItems.description: Divorce, cultural changes and communication problems can make it hard for men to repair their relationships with the children they love.

feedItems.title: The Benefits of Getting to Know Your Future Self
feedItems.description: Many of us feel little connection with the person we’ll be decades from now. That can lead to shortsighted behavior that hurts us in the long run.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In garments scarce, so sheer and thin,
The bravest maidens, baring skin,
Where sea-born gods and giants stride,
Their dresses whisper like the tide.

As thunderclouds anon arise,
To hide the sun from watching eyes,
The dread of battles fought once more,
Trump and Biden stand ashore.

As crafty Loki, spawned by fire,
Meta's journey doth inspire,
Zuckerberg with thoughts profound,
Seeketh knowledge with no bound.

feedItems.title: Cutouts, Sheer Dresses, No Pants: How to Pull Off 'Naked Dressing'
feedItems.description: Barely there, see-through and otherwise skimpy outfits are dominating runways and red carpets. But you needn’t show all to try the trend. Here, expert advice on how to wear “naked” clothes chicly—even to work.

feedItems.title: No One Is Looking Forward to the 2024 Election
feedItems.description: Donald Trump and President Biden appear headed for a repeat of 2020, and many voters are dreading the prospect.

feedItems.title: Mark Zuckerberg Was Early in AI. Now Meta Is Trying to Catch Up.
feedItems.description: CEO Mark Zuckerberg has invested for more than a decade in academic discoveries about AI, even making them open for others to view and use. Now Meta is behind in making consumer products like ChatGPT.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of Pepper and Salt, a tale I tell,
A seasoning dance, a savory spell,
Like holy water, of wine and ale,
Blessèd be, those flavors regale.

Daniel Ellsberg, in God's embrace,
Leaked Pentagon truths with courage and grace,
At ninety and two, hath met his fate,
In heaven's peace may his soul partake.

A challenge for Biden's reign doth bloom,
With threats of dark AI, I assume,
Curbing Chinese investments' plume,
In matters of state, a war to consume.

feedItems.title: Died: Daniel Ellsberg, 92, military analyst who leaked the Pentagon Papers.
feedItems.description: Died: Daniel Ellsberg, 92, military analyst who leaked the Pentagon Papers.

feedItems.title: The Biden administration is grappling with how to identify artificial intelligence that poses a threat to national security, as the U.S. moves to curb investment in advanced technology companies in China.
feedItems.description: The Biden administration is grappling with how to identify artificial intelligence that poses a threat to national security, as the U.S. moves to curb investment in advanced technology companies in China.
